channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-15476] ObjectStore.getMTableColumnStatistics() should check if colNames is empty
item.description:
See the following exception in the log. Can't find out which exact query causes it though.

[pool-4-thread-31]: Exception thrown
Method/Identifier expected at character 37 in "tableName == t1 && dbName == t2 && ()"

item.summary: ObjectStore.getMTableColumnStatistics() should check if colNames is empty

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: patch-1: Not sure what kind of query causes it but add the check for empty or null column names so it won't fail for such case.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12844123/HIVE-15476.1.patch

ERROR: -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12844123 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

aihuaxu When the query ends up being "tableName == t1 && dbName == t2 && ()", we would want the query to be "tableName == t1 && dbName == t2 right? so that should still return the stats for all columns in the table? With the patch, we just return when the column list is empty, so no table stats for that table are returned.
What should the behavior be? Thanks
patch-2: minor change to add comment for the function.
From the directSQL implementation, we are returning NULL when columns are not provided.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12844472/HIVE-15476.2.patch

Thanks for the comments. The proposed fix is consistent with the current behavior. So +1 for me.
Pushed to master. Thanks Naveen for reviewing.
